required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Master Study for the Investigation of Safety and Efficacy of the SIELLO Pacemaker Leads
clinical_study.official_title: Master Study of the SIELLO Pacemaker Leads

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to prove the safety and efficacy of the SIELLO pacemaker leads.

detailed_description.textblock: The assessment of the safety of SIELLO pacemaker leads is based on the collection of complications which are related to the leads. The assessment of efficacy of the SIELLO pacemaker leads is based on the collection of standard electrical lead data during the implant and follow-up procedures. Subsequent to the implantation of the SIELLO leads,five follow-up visits have been scheduled: at pre-discharge and after 1, 3, 6 and 12 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Complication free rate of all SIELLO leads
Ventricular threshold of SIELLO T (passive fixation)
Atrial threshold of SIELLO S (active fixation)

intervention.description: Implantation of the SIELLO pacemaker leads

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Meet the indications for pacemaker therapy
- Understand the nature of the procedure
- Give informed consent
- Able to complete all testing required by the clinical protocol
- Available for follow-up visits on a regular basis at the investigational site
Exclusion Criteria:
- Meet none of the pacemaker indications
- Meet one or more of the contraindications
- Have a life expectancy of less than six months
- Cardiac surgery in the next six months -Enrolled in another cardiac clinical investigation- Have other medical devices that may interact with the implanted pacemaker
